com.mapbox.services.android.navigation.v5

Interface AlertLevelChangeListener


  • public interface AlertLevelChangeListener
    Listening in to the alertLevelChange is useful for correctly getting the timing of user notifications while the user is traversing along the route. The listener's invoked only when the user's reached a specific point along the current step they are on. The alert thresholds can be adjusted within the constants file while developing and are based on time (in seconds) till the user reaches the next maneuver.

    This is an experimental API. Experimental APIs are quickly evolving and might change or be removed in minor versions.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    AlertLevelChange documentation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAlertLevelChange(int alertLevel, com.mapbox.services.api.navigation.v5.RouteProgress routeProgress)
      Method's invoked when the alert level has changed during the current navigation session.

    • Method Detail

      • onAlertLevelChange

        void onAlertLevelChange(int alertLevel,
                        com.mapbox.services.api.navigation.v5.RouteProgress routeProgress)
        Method's invoked when the alert level has changed during the current navigation session.
        Parameters:
        alertLevel - One of the alert level constants found in Constants.
        routeProgress - Provides a RouteProgress object which will contain information about the users current position along the route.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        AlertLevelChange documentation
